body_html:
with flag -DUSE_OPENCV=0, Caffe2 will be built without OpenCV support, which may not be an optimal configuration especially if you want to use Detectron.

since there was Qt5 error, my suggestion is to install Qt5 dependencies via apt and build OpenCV with Qt5 support. something like:

sudo apt-get install -y qt5-default libvtk6-dev

//when building OpenCV from source
cmake -DWITH_QT=ON -DWITH_OPENGL=ON -DFORCE_VTK=ON -DWITH_TBB=ON -DWITH_GDAL=ON -DWITH_XINE=ON -DBUILD_EXAMPLES=ON -DENABLE_PRECOMPILED_HEADERS=OFF ..

with flag -DUSE_OPENCV=0, Caffe2 will be built without OpenCV support, which may not be an optimal configuration especially if you want to use Detectron.

since there was Qt5 error, my suggestion is to install Qt5 dependencies via apt and build OpenCV with Qt5 support. something like:

    sudo apt-get install -y qt5-default libvtk6-dev
    
    //when building OpenCV from source
    cmake -DWITH_QT=ON -DWITH_OPENGL=ON -DFORCE_VTK=ON -DWITH_TBB=ON -DWITH_GDAL=ON -DWITH_XINE=ON -DBUILD_EXAMPLES=ON -DENABLE_PRECOMPILED_HEADERS=OFF ..
